alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 3:37PM EDT until April 12 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Broward County in southeastern Florida... * Until 645 PM EDT. * At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen during the last couple of hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible with these training thunderstorms in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Lauderhill, Dania Beach, Chula Vista, Fort Lauderdale - Hollywood International Airport, Ravenswood Estates, Melrose Park, Estates Of Fort Lauderdale, Downtown Fort Lauderdale, Washington Park, Broadview Park, Franklin Park, Port Everglades, Oak Point, Chambers Estates and St. George. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
